inclusion.criterion: American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Physical Status Classification
inclusion.label: I, II, or III

inclusion.criterion: surgically sterilized, or pre-menopausal with negative pregnancy test within 7 days before study
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: male, 18-55 years old, who has more than 3 risk factors for PONV
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: undergoing outpatient laparoscopic gynecological surgery or laparoscopic abdominal surgery, scheduled for between 1 and 3 hours duration
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: known to have a history of post-operative nausea and vomiting and/or a history of motion sickness
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: has been a non-smoker for at least the previous 12 consecutive months
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: able and willing to complete a subject diary until the end of the 96 Hour Follow-Up Assessment period
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: will be available to respond to follow-up by study personnel at 72 and 96 hours post emergence from anesthesia
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: ASA Physical Status Classification of IV or V
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: taking more than 10-15mg of oxycodone, or an equivalent opioid dose, on a regular, daily basis, for more than 3 consecutive days before surgery
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: received investigational drug in the previous 30 days or who is scheduled to receive any investigational drug during the study period
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: persistent or recurrent nausea and/or vomiting due to other etiologies, including but not limited to, gastric outlet obstruction, hypercalcemia, active peptic ulcer, increased intracranial pressure, or brain metastases
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: experienced retching or vomiting or uncontrolled nausea within 48 hours before administration of study drug
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: received medication with known or potential antiemetic activity within 24 hours before receiving study drug
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has abdominal pain and vomiting, but no history of allergies or using any medications. He drinks around 60 units of alcohol per week and smokes 22 cigarettes per day.
